result.execSummary:
The defendant Yasmin I. Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 1 day sentence credit if revoked. Any violations of probation to be reported to Court at least 30 days prior to probation terminating.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
  Counseling shall specifically include:   Anger management / DV counseling.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100.00  ea applicable count).
** If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
**  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not have contact with Gabriel Cotto J., unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yasmin I. Perez

records.addlTxt: Cash bond applied; partial refund;   mi/mg   ck#22CH090585
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

01:35 PM  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Yasmin I. Perez, appeared pro se.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolve. DE waives her right to an attorney and would like to proceed today. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 1 is dismissed and read in.   Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions. 1 day sentence credit if revoked. No restitution requested.  Court costs, DNA surcharge and DV surcharge ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample, notice given to def. in court.  Appeal rights given.
to Judge; forwarded to Br. 3 for review.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Fr: Court re: rotation. Copy mailed to DE by clerk.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued Posted
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Gabriel C jr - 3rd party pick up/drop off of child.

305PM   Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.   Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.   Plea of Not Guilty entered by the Court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 02:10 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm. $650 Cash Bond continued posted w/ additional conditions (see bond entry). mi
and witness list filed by the State
